com.cognifide.slice.api.context

Interface Context

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MapContext, ServletRequestContext

    public interface Context
    Author:
    Rafa≈Ç Malinowski Context for ContextScoped objects and Injectors. This class is stores objects mapped by Key class. Null values can be stored. Use contains() to check if given Key is available in Context. Calling get() and checking for null is not enough, because Context can store null values as well.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> boolean contains(com.google.inject.Key<T> key)
      Check if value for given key is stored in this Context.
      <T> T get(com.google.inject.Key<T> key)
      Get value stored under given key.
      <T> void put(com.google.inject.Key<T> key, T object)
      Put new object for given key.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        <T> boolean contains(com.google.inject.Key<T> key)
        Check if value for given key is stored in this Context.
        Parameters:
        key - key to check
        Returns:
        true if value for key is stored

      • put

        <T> void put(com.google.inject.Key<T> key,
           T object)
        Put new object for given key. Object can be null.
        Parameters:
        key - key to store new object under
        object - new object to store or null

      • get

        <T> T get(com.google.inject.Key<T> key)
        Get value stored under given key. If no value or null value was stored this method will return null. Use contains() to differentiate between these two cases.
        Parameters:
        key - key to get value for
        Returns:
        value for given key
